description: From French allantoïde, and its source, Renaissance Latin allantoides, from Koine Greek ἀλλαντοειδής (allantoeidḗs, “sausage-shaped”), from Ancient Greek ἀλλάς (allás, “sausage”); surface analysis, allant- +‎ -oid.

adjectives.description: allantoid (comparative more allantoid, superlative most allantoid)

entries.meaning: (now chiefly mycology) Sausage-shaped; especially with reference to fungal spores that are long with rounded ends. [from 18th c.]

examples: The allantoide in some animals seems to have become extinct; in others is above tenfold the size, which would seem necessary for its purpose.
